meanings.definition: To put a soul into; to endow with a soul.
meanings.sent1: She insouls her stories with characters that come to life.
meanings.sent2: The artist insouls the painting with emotion and depth.
meanings.sent3: The magician insouls the puppet, making it dance on its own!
meanings.sent4: His music insouls the audience, lifting their spirits to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The writer insouls her poems with passion, making them resonate with readers.

meanings.definition: To fill with spirit or courage.
meanings.sent1: The coach insouls the team before the big game.
meanings.sent2: Her words insoul him with the strength to face his fears.
meanings.sent3: The teacher insouls the students to believe in themselves.
meanings.sent4: The hero's actions insoul the villagers to stand up against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The melody insouls her with the bravery to speak her mind.
